p: The phenols content in the crude juices were calorimetrically estimated using the Folin- Ciocalteau assay [ 8]. The absorbance was performed at 760 nm by a UV–vis spectrophotometer (Shimadzu, UVmini-1240, Japan). TP content in the crude juices were calculated and presented as milligrams equivalent of gallic acid per gram dry weight (mg GAE/g DW) by refer to regression equation of standard curve (Y = 0.0122x – 0.0066, R 2 = 0.9873).
